events.description: Gold climbed back above the $5,000 per ounce level on Wednesday.
US forces downed an Iranian drone near an aircraft carrier in the Arabian Sea.
President Trump nominated Kevin Warsh as Federal Reserve chair.
Scheduled talks between the US and Iran for Friday.
A shutdown causing delays in economic data reporting.
House Republicans set to vote on a Senate-approved funding package on Tuesday.

facts.fact_text: Gold price exceeded $5,000 per ounce on Wednesday.

evidences.evidence_text: Gold climbed back above the key $5,000 per ounce level on Wednesday

facts.fact_text: Gold experienced a 6% surge in the session prior to Wednesday.

evidences.evidence_text: building on a more than 6% surge in the previous session, the biggest daily gain since 2008

facts.fact_text: US forces shot down an Iranian drone in the Arabian Sea.

evidences.evidence_text: US forces downed an Iranian drone near an aircraft carrier in the Arabian Sea

facts.fact_text: Kevin Warsh has been nominated as the next Fed chair.

evidences.evidence_text: Trump nominated Kevin Warsh as Fed chair

facts.fact_text: US labor data releases are delayed due to a government shutdown.

evidences.evidence_text: key US labor data, including JOLTS and the monthly jobs report, will be delayed by the partial government shutdown

claims.claim_text: Dip buyers were responsible for the gold price recovery.

evidences.evidence_text: as dip buyers stepped in following a sharp pullback earlier in the week

claims.claim_text: Geopolitical tensions increased the demand for gold as a safe-haven asset.

evidences.evidence_text: Geopolitical tensions also lifted the metal’s safe-haven appeal

claims.claim_text: The nomination of Kevin Warsh reduced expectations for aggressive rate cuts.

evidences.evidence_text: expectations for rapid Federal Reserve rate cuts eased after Trump nominated Kevin Warsh as Fed chair

claims.claim_text: Markets are pricing in two interest rate cuts for the current year.
claims.author: Markets

evidences.evidence_text: markets still price in two cuts this year, likely around mid-year and later in 2026

evidence.evidence_text: Geopolitical tensions also lifted the metal’s safe-haven appeal
expectations for rapid Federal Reserve rate cuts eased after Trump nominated Kevin Warsh as Fed chair
key US labor data, including JOLTS and the monthly jobs report, will be delayed by the partial government shutdown
Gold climbed back... as dip buyers stepped in
